AI Description: The Square Kilometre Array (SKA) is a next-generation radio telescope project that aims to be the world's largest and most sensitive radio telescope, with an unprecedented level of detail and speed in observing the universe.
Core Features: The SKA will enable scientists to address fundamental questions in astrophysics, cosmology, and astrobiology, providing insights into the origins and nature of the universe. It will have a wide field of view, high sensitivity, and high resolution, allowing for detailed studies of a wide range of celestial objects and phenomena.
